metadata.title: CVE-2017-7762 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
When entered directly, Reader Mode did not strip the username and passwordsection of URLs displayed in the addressbar. This can be used for spoofingthe domain of the current page. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 54.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7762` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
